meanings.definition: To hatch or cause to hatch from an egg.
meanings.sent1: The hen will cleck the eggs until they hatch.
meanings.sent2: The mother bird will cleck the eggs to help her babies come out.
meanings.sent3: The farmer joked that the hen would cleck all day and night.
meanings.sent4: The warm sun seemed to cleck the flowers into bloom.
meanings.sent5: The magic potion seemed to cleck the potion ingredients into life.

meanings.definition: A brood or clutch of eggs.
meanings.sent1: The nest held a cleck of colorful eggs.
meanings.sent2: The bird carefully sat on her cleck to keep them warm.
meanings.sent3: The children marveled at the cleck of eggs in the science exhibit.
meanings.sent4: The treasure chest was like a cleck of golden jewels.
meanings.sent5: The basket was filled with a cleck of fresh eggs from the farm.
